meanings.definition: A strong, offensive smell or odor.
meanings.sent1: The nidor from the garbage can made me hold my nose.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen was filled with the nidor of burnt toast.
meanings.sent3: The nidor from the gym socks was so bad, it made the dog run away.
meanings.sent4: The nidor of failure hung heavy in the air after the exam.
meanings.sent5: The nidor of the skunk sprayed all around, making everyone gag.

meanings.definition: To emit a strong, offensive smell.
meanings.sent1: The flowers nidored in the hot sun, attracting bees.
meanings.sent2: The garbage began to nidor after sitting out in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The old cheese nidored so strongly that it set off the smoke alarm.
meanings.sent4: His lies began to nidor, revealing the truth to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The swamp nidored with the scent of decay, warning travelers to stay away.
